section.title: Definition
section.para: A common attribute occurring in the config-rpm/files, config-rpm/script, and config-rpm/trigger sub-elements, the @content attribute accepts either "filename" or "raw". When content is "filename", the element's text value is treated as a PATH to a file, whereas when it is "raw", the element's text value is interpreted as the raw text a file to use. Unless otherwise specified, the default value for content is "filename".

section.title: Definition
section.para: An absolute or relative DIRNAME (path) to a folder after which Spin places the final item of the parent element $input. Spin creates this destination folder if it does not exist. If this DIRNAME is absolute, the final file location will ignore the PATH-like element's $default.

section.title: Examples
section.para:
In the following examples, the value of $default is /var/www/html.
<files destdir="hgweb">/var/input/samba-splash.jpg</files> <files destdir="/hgweb">/var/input/samba-splash.jpg</files>
The paths specified above result in these corresponding destinations.
/var/www/html/hgweb/samba-splash.jpg /hgweb/samba-splash.jpg

section.title: Definition
section.para: Specify the filename to use for the given $input after it is copied to its destination. If not given, Spin uses the basename of the $input.

section.title: Examples
section.para:
In the following examples, the value of $default is /var/www/html.
<files destname="output.jpg">/var/input/samba-splash.jpg</files> <files destdir="hgweb" destname="output.jpg">/var/input/samba-splash.jpg</files>
The paths specified above result in these corresponding destinations.
/var/www/html/output.jpg /var/www/html/hgweb/output.jpg

section.title: Definition
section.para: BOOLEAN value that controls whether Spin uses the module associated with the top-level element in the build process. All top-level elements can be disabled except for <main>.
This attribute's default value is TRUE.

section.title: Definition
section.para: The numeric file MODE to apply to the $input (if a file) or recursively to all files, including those in subfolders, below $input (if a directory) after it has been copied. If not specified, uses 0644.
